Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Kenneth Bogan, Pastor, Greater Restoration Baptist Church, 1156 Saint John's Place, Brooklyn, NY 11213.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member James.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Kenneth Bogan, Pastor, Greater Restoration Baptist Church, 1156 Saint John's Place, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11213.

Council Member Yassky moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of June 27 and July 25, 2007 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gentile.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Reyna moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of Monday, September 10, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Communication from the Department of Finance - Submitting Third Party Transfer Program Bronx, In Rem Action No. 49, Community Districts No. 6, 12, Council Districts No. 12, 15.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Submitting Third Party Transfer Program Bronx, In Rem Action No. 49, Community Districts No. 6, 12, Council Districts No. 12, 15.

Items.Title: Communication from the Department of Finance - Submitting Third Party Transfer Program Bronx, In Rem Action No. 49, Community Districts No. 3, 6, 9, 12 Council Districts No. 11, 15, 16, 18.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Submitting Third Party Transfer Program Bronx, In Rem Action No. 49, Community Districts No. 3, 6, 9, 12 Council Districts No. 11, 15, 16, 18.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 1650 Broadway Community Board 5 Application 20075564 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 1650 Broadway Associates Inc., Manhattan (20075564TCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 040162 ZSK, a special permit, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Kings Material, Brooklyn (C040162ZSK)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Civil Service Law to allow candidates for employment who are veterans to use military credit points multiple times on more than one eligible list.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Amend the Civil Service Law to allow candidates for employment who are veterans to use military credit points multiple times on more than one eligible list.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to façade inspections and air conditioners.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Façade inspections and air conditioners.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the U.S. Congress to pass H.R. 2236, also known as the Breastfeeding Promotion Act of 2007.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass H.R. 2236, also known as the Breastfeeding Promotion Act of 2007.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to preserve the existing Green Thumb Community Gardens and to set aside more parkland, open space and vacant lots to be developed as permanent Green Thumb Community Gardens.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Preserve the existing Green Thumb Community Gardens.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Office of Court Administration to stop selling information from landlord/tenant proceedings in the Housing Part of the New York City Civil Court.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Office of Court Administration to stop selling information from landlord/tenant proceedings in the Housing Part of the New York City Civil Court.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating professional certification of plans submitted to the department of buildings regarding curb cuts and requiring the notification of community boards and council members upon the receipt by the department of buildings of an application for a curb cut.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Eliminating professional certification of plans submitted to the department of buildings regarding curb cuts and requiring the notification of community boards and council members.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the illegally created curb cuts to be restored, making those who maintain illegally created curb cuts liable for penalties, requiring the department of transportation to restore illegally created curb cuts and providing for the reimbursement to the department for the cost for such work.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the illegally created curb cuts to be restored, making those who maintain illegally created curb cuts liable for penalties.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.5948 to amend the private housing finance law, or in the alternative, to authorize the City to enact a local law that would provide tenants a right of first refusal in the event that their Mitchell-Lama or project-based Section 8 buildings are sold, in order to preserve affordable housing in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.5948 to amend the private housing finance law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to protection of trees during construction.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Protection of trees during construction.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 070506 HAX, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located at 3100, 3120 Third Avenue; 747 Elton Avenue; 507 East 158th Street, and the disposition of such  property, Borough of the Bronx, Council District no. 17.  This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 3100, 3120 Third Ave.; 747 Elton Ave.; 507 E. 158th St., Bronx (C070506HAX)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 070507 ZSX, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of the Bronx, Council District no. 17 to facilitate construction of an eight-story mixed use building.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d (b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Melrose Commons RFP-B-7, Bronx (C070507ZSX)

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 040161 ZMK pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning changes to the zoning map, Section 22c, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 39.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Kings Material, Brooklyn (C040161ZMK)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Acting Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, September 25, 2007.

                                                                         MICHAEL McSWEENEY, First Deputy City Clerk
                                                                                                         Acting Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Int No. 351-A   (override vote) 46-2-0

Items.MinutesNote: Notwithstanding the objection of the Mayor, the Council adopted Int No. 351-A and thereby enacted this bill into law.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the thousands of innocent people and brave uniformed workers who lost their lives six years ago on September 11, 2001 and in support for all those suffering from the lingering health effects.  

The Speaker (Council Member Quinn) also asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the following individuals:
Irene Morgan Kirkaldy, 90, recipient of  the Presidential Citizens Medal, who died on August 10, 2007 of Alzheimer's Disease.  Ms Kikaldy was an early civil rights advocate whose fight  segregation led to a June 1946 U.S. Supreme Court decison outlawing segregation on interstate buses.  She later moved to Long Island and ran a child care center in Queens.

Dr. Carolyn Goodman, 91, who died on August 17, 2007 at her Upper West Side home.
Ms. Goodman was a political activist whose son Andrew Goodman was killed in Mississippi during the 1964 "Freedom Summer".

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
